main event: A witness saw a bright fireball falling from the sky near Hamilton, Ontario on April 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object lit up the area bright as day,The witness described it as coming down at a 60Â° angle,It landed roughly one mile away in the woods,The sighting was reported to Canadian police but deemed possibly a balloon or meteor,The U.S. Naval Research Laboratory later suggested it could have been a bolide.
witness description: a machinist from Hules Brush Co.
